examples: a story that doesn't jibe with the facts

definition: to deride or tease with taunting words
examples: boxers gibing each other before a fight

definition: to shift suddenly and forcibly from one side to the other
examples: was the most amazed when he saw me work the boat to and again in the sea by the rudder, and how the sail jibed, and filled this way or that way as the course we sailed changed
the cutter had lost all four foremost men by the violent jibing of a boom

definition: to change a vessel's course when sailing with the wind so that as the stern passes through the eye of the wind the boom swings to the opposite side
to cause (a sail or vessel) to jibe
examples: this maneuver was bound to force her to jibe her mainsail from one side to the other
